    • Block

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public Block clone()
      Clones this block, but does not clone the connectors. That should be handled by caller of this function, as it is impossible for this clone function to derive the clone of another block that might be connected to one of these connectors.
      Overrides:
      clone in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A newly cloned block with references to the old connectors

    • getPosition

      public int[] getPosition()

    • setCoords

      public void setCoords​(int newX, int newY)
      Sets the coordinates for this block by updating the position variable.
      Parameters:
      newX - the new x coordinate
      newY - the new y coordinate

    • setDimensions

      public void setDimensions​(int[] dimensions)
      Parameters:
      dimensions - the new dimensions of the block. Dimensions uses following order [x, y, width, height]

    • updateConnectedBlocksPositions

      public void updateConnectedBlocksPositions()
      Update the position of the lower/right/body blocks that are connected to this block.

    • inRange

      public boolean inRange​(double x, double y)

    • getConnectors

      public java.util.ArrayList<Connector> getConnectors()

      public void setConnectors​(java.util.ArrayList<Connector> newConnectors)

      public java.util.ArrayList<Connector> getFreeConnectors()

    • getBlocksInScope

      public java.util.ArrayList<Block> getBlocksInScope()
      Returns:
      all blocks which are below, to the right, or in a body of this block.

    • getConnector

      public Connector getConnector​(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
      Parameters:
      cls - the class of the connector
      Returns:
      a connector of the given connector class or if no such connector exists return null

    • getBlock

      public Block getBlock​(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
      Given the class of a connector, return the block (if any) that is connected by a connector of that class to this block.
      Parameters:
      cls - a connector class used to determine the type of a block.
      Returns:
      the block of the given type to which this block is connected or null if this block does not exists

    • getNextConnectedBlocks

      public java.util.ArrayList<Block> getNextConnectedBlocks()
      Returns:
      all blocks connected to this block, in a downward direction. This means that the lower, right and body blocks will be returned, but any blocks higher or more to the left won't be.

    • addConnector

      public void addConnector​(Connector connector)

    • isBodyBlockOf

      public boolean isBodyBlockOf​(Block otherBlock)
      Parameters:
      otherBlock - the block to be checked
      Returns:
      true if otherBlock is a conditionBlock and this block is its bodyBlock

    • updateConnectorPositions

      public void updateConnectorPositions()

    • getDepth

      public int getDepth()
      Gives an integer representing the depth of a block. Since for a block to be deeper in scope than another block, it has to lie within another block (a wrapper block such as a While or If block). This means that the height of a block can be used to determine if it is deeper than another block.
      Returns:
      The depth of a block. Depth is used in ProgramArea to help determine which block should be dragged

    • isHighlighted

      public boolean isHighlighted()

    • setHighlighted

      public void setHighlighted​(boolean newHighlight)
